doc.field: The collection contains the yearbook, clippings, programs, and report cards of Lenore Schwartz, dating from 1922 to 1937. The report cards, programs, and yearbook document the educational life of Lenore Schwartz. The collection includes Lenore's high school yearbook at Erasmus High School from 1937, which documents Lenore's relationships, social life at Erasmus Hall, and more. Additionally, the clippings and programs document the students and social life at Erasmus Hall.

The collection contains the yearbook, clippings, programs, and report cards of Lenore Schwartz, dating from 1922 to 1937. The report cards, programs, and yearbook document the educational life of Lenore Schwartz. The collection includes Lenore's high school yearbook at Erasmus High School from 1937, which documents Lenore's relationships, social life at Erasmus Hall, and more. Additionally, the clippings and programs document the students and social life at Erasmus Hall.

The collection consists of one yearbook, thirteen report cards, two programs, one school newspaper, and clippings. The bulk of the material, including a yearbook, programs for school events, school newspaper, clippings, and five report cards relate to Erasmus Hall High School, and date from 1934 to 1936. The remaining report cards are from Huntington Public Schools (circa 1927-1929), PS 87 (Queens, 1931), and Montauk Junior High School (1933-1934).

Lenore Schwartz was born on November 2 1919. She grew up in Brooklyn and lived with her parents, Abraham and May Schwartz, at 1330 East 4th Street in Midwood. Lenore attended Erasmus Hall High School, and later worked for the Jewish Welfare Board and United States Organizations in New York until 1944, at which point she relocated for that job to Hawaii. Lenore married Albert Rosenbaum in 1948, relocated to southern California, and had a son and a daughter. She passed away on April 15th 2015.
